content: This is the right question, and it's the one that will determine whether the council reads the document as "visionary design with execution potential" or "impressive theory looking for operators." Let me help you think through how to frame this, because the transcript actually reveals more positioning strength than you might realize. Here's what the council can already infer from the materials — and what you should make explicit. What the transcript reveals about your positioning. One of you lives in a Brigade apartment community in Bangalore, sits on the board of a nonprofit association there, and was already building transparent accounting infrastructure for that community before this project crystallized. That's not a theoretical relationship to community governance — that's lived operational experience with the exact dynamics this platform addresses: nonprofit structure, collective decision-making, physical community, financial transparency needs. The other appears to be based in or connected to Zurich, has built a sophisticated AI-assisted product development pipeline (the council system, automated spec-to-deploy workflow), and has deep technical execution capacity. You built that entire system overnight, which signals the kind of builder who can ship an Open Collective fork with custom layers. So the honest positioning is something like: one community operator with nonprofit governance experience embedded in the Bangalore target market, plus one technical builder with product infrastructure capability embedded in the Zurich target market. That's actually a strong founding complement for a phased launch that starts in Zurich and expands to Bangalore. What you should be transparent about. You're participants and community members, not professional facilitators. You haven't run the Phase 1 experiments yet. You haven't done the 10–20 facilitator interviews. The council will respect this honesty far more than inflated claims, especially because your Phase 1 design is explicitly manual validation — you've already built the "we don't know yet, so we're testing" posture into the plan. The document's rigor is itself evidence of execution discipline. What you should articulate as next steps before the council evaluates. The single highest-leverage thing you could do is conduct 10–15 facilitator conversations across Zurich and Bangalore in the next 2–4 weeks and append a "Facilitator Discovery Summary" to the document. Even five conversations with Zurich-based ecstatic dance or breathwork facilitators — asking them to walk you through their current tool stack, their biggest operational frustrations, whether they'd adopt transparent economics, and what would make them trust a new platform — would transform the council's confidence. The competitive landscape research gives you excellent conversation starters: "I noticed you're using Eventbrite plus Venmo plus WhatsApp — how does that actually work for sliding-scale?" opens doors immediately. The Brigade community is also a ready-made testing ground. You're already on the board of a nonprofit association in a dense physical community. Running 2–3 small events there using the manual Phase 1 toolkit (Google Forms, WhatsApp, Google Sheets for cost transparency) before the council review would give you real data points, however small. How I'd suggest you frame it in the document. Add a short "Founders and Execution Context" section, maybe half a page, that states plainly: who you are, your relationship to the space (participant, community board member, builder), what you've done so far (this design process, the competitive analysis, the AI-assisted development infrastructure), what you haven't done yet (facilitator interviews, pilot events), and your concrete plan to close that gap before committing resources. The council rewards self-awareness about what's validated versus what's assumed. Your Phase 1 is designed to close exactly this gap — make that connection explicit. Want me to draft that section for the document, or would you prefer to talk through how to structure the facilitator interview guide first? The interviews are probably higher leverage right now than more document refinement. Opus 4.6Extended
